message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.CR 

The paper deals with a problem of active feature acquisition, which involves selecting the most informative subset of features to achieve the maximum prediction performance in a cost-effective way. This problem is relevant to several subfields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), natural language processing (cs.CL), computer vision (cs.CV), and cryptography (cs.CR). However, given that the paper focuses on developing a reinforcement learning framework for joint learning of the RL agent and the classifier, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. The use of LSTM-based set encoding mechanism also suggests relevance to cs.CL. The paper does not deal with cryptography, so cs.CR is the least likely sub-category.
